intro: Siphocampylus decumbens, commonly known as the decumbent siphocampylus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with slender stems that lie close to the ground. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbellate inflorescences, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a hairy surface that aids in moisture retention. Native to certain regions of South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
